Reviews.Title: “Well located - Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: Stephen G
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel for two nights. Rooms are self contained which is handy if you want to look after your own meals. Kitchen is small and very basic. Rooms are of a good size and ours had been recently renovated. Several floors of the Hotel currently under renovation which creates some minor noise problems at the moment. Hotel very well located to the Port area of Barcelona. Metro within 80 metres. Breakfast was average but in keeping with the price your being charged.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and good location.”
Reviews.Author: LimList
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my daughters and found the hotel very good value. They are doing up the rooms to be more like a boutique hotel, and we got one of the updated rooms which was large and comfortable. Yes, the breakfast is basic, but there were 4 kinds of fruit every day and spanish omelette in addition to the usual continental breakfast. The area doesn't feel very safe at night, but that's true of many places! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “dont go”
Reviews.Author: roey m
Reviews.Content: Hotel receptionists behavior is very, very bad, old receptionist refers in disparagingand for every complaint you receive the following response: "You can leave if you are dissatisfied." Strange noises in the rooms, each room is different from the other and you never know what to expect, the pictures do not represent the hotel. Dining room is very, very bad, the food all the time over there places to sit, no vegetables. Very veryexpensive compared to what you get. Not get under any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: RonLev
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the center of the city 100m from Drassanes Metro station. Excellent service. Basic Breakfast. Great value for money. Will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value city break”
Reviews.Author: IonutDragu
Reviews.Content: We`ve stayed in room 408 and it was the best we could get for our city break in Barcelona. The room was clean and the staff friendly. The breakfast was a little poor but just around the corner you can get fresh food from the Boqueria market. It was a great experience and we intend to revisit Barcelona ... soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Danreichardt
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend, super central location mid town, nice simple, easy, clean hotel, ok breakfast with something for everbody. For sure good base for visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Close to La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: 49eamo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located only 2 minutes walk from the bottom of La Rambla, and is pretty quiet from outside noise, despite the location. The 3 am noise we experienced was from fellow guests, but didn't last too long. Breakfast is just about adequate, and, due to the large number of guests, is best eaten no later than about 09.00 am. Its also 1 minute from Drassanes metro station on the L3 line, which connects directly to Sants railway station, for onward rail travel, or for the airport train. Yes it is hard to find, but if you get dropped at the entrance to the Maritime museum, and look across the road at the 11 o'clock point, you will see a tall skyscraper. The hotel is at the far side of this building, diadonally opposite the corner nearest you. If arriving by the metro, exit onto "Madrone", not "Rambla", and you will be right beside the skyscraper mentioned earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the negative comments...well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: seds83uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3nights, were a young couple on budget. The location is perfect, right at the bottom of the ramblas, right next to a metro station, so everything in barca is a quick trip away! Sure, the entrance is in a back road and the immediate surroundings are dark at night, but we never felt any issues, and we came home after midnight each night. My only negatives are a) the breakfast area is a bit small, we had to wait for a few mins for a table, and the tv could have had some English channels! Other than that, highly recommended for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Above average due to location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Enoikos
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on a colleague's suggestion, for attending the GSMA Mobile World Congress and in view of scarcity for other options. I had a "superior" room in the 6th floor, which was extremely tiny (check photos) and was noisy due to the fan in the roof-top. A colleague of mine asked for a room transfer and his request was indeed promptly fulfilled. Free WiFi (despite the frequent interuptions) was more than useful for Skype calls and remote access to mails. Room was equipped with a large 32'' Samsung LED TV from a strange viewing position and a kitchenette. I would prefer a kettler and a mug, instead of boiling water in a cacherole (BTW: I was given a cup from the restaraunt to use for my coffee and the cleaner took it away next day ...). A plus is that hotel is 100% NON-smoking. Breakfast was well below average in both quality and quantity. Because of the congress the hotel is on the pricey side, but the rate was normal the last day, for a 3stars/keys hotel. I have rated this hotel above average because of the very polite staff and the location which is close to Las Ramblas and literally within 30 meters (in the same building block) to the entrance of Drasanes metro station. Using the L3 green line I could be to the congress site and sight-seeing locations within minutes. Recommended but with some reservartions. There are far better hotels in better price in Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shirley3636
Reviews.Content: Very Close to La Rambla + Metro Stop Hotel Breakfast was ok, dont expect a full English as its not in the Uk. Bread, fresh orange, coffee, hams and spreads. They do refill when needed but you may need to ask if they havent seen already. Stayed in June 2010 in Superior room and would recommend. Stayed again in December 2010 in a double and it didnt have the same effect. Was offered and upgrade which we could take the following day. The gentleman that was on the next day didnt give us it which was disappointing. View from the hotel shows in the photo!!! Had a problem with the hotel safe which took some explaining but was resolved in the end. Overall friendly staff which are helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, not bad location, clean.”
Reviews.Author: jakub-krakau
Reviews.Content: Generally good value for money. The apartments are in a really great location, just near the bottom end of La Ramblas and Christopher Columbus statue. However, this area is generally not safe to walk around at midnight. At about 200 meters there are some supermarkets. Also close to the Gothic Quarter. The rooms are basic, but everything was clean and adequate for our needs. We had some problems with wifi connection. Standard breakfast was included in the price, but the service at that point was a little bit poor (the same choice every day). Staff were very helpful and polite (they speak english).

Reviews.Title: “Decent room but wasn't impressed overall”
Reviews.Author: sashalex
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Gutenberg is in the middle of a renovation - which is a good thing, it needs it. Our room had been renovated and was comfortable and spare but cutely decorated so when we were in the room, all was well... but the rest of the hotel left a lot to be desired. The hallways, cafe and reception were depressing. The staff was disinterested bordering on rude. The location is a little odd. We liked being close to Las Ramblas the Boqueria but the surrounding streets were pretty empty and a haven for junkies. We were never threatened but saw people shooting up right on the hotel's corner and another night saw a guy throw a syringe in the gutter. I live in Brooklyn and consider myself pretty tough but it was a little gross.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: BauldelaPiquer
Reviews.Content: Accomodation in Barcelona tends to be really expensive if you're looking for something just standard: if you're looking for soemthing "cheap" you'll probably end up in a crappy hostel -and I mean CRAPPY. So I was most amazed to find Gutenberg Hotel for that cheap price that we paid. The room was clean, location good (just a bit hidden behind a corner), facilities were renovated, rooms spacious and they even included a kitchen area in case you want to extra-save money during your stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can, however staff are pleasent”
Reviews.Author: Gleneagle66
Reviews.Content: We ere booked into this hotel by Flights and Packages.com as the one they advertised on there site was full up, it looked at lot grander than the Aparthotel Gutenberg however they assured me it was the same standard. The staff were pleasant we have 7 people in our party 3 rooms on check in we got into the small out of date lift which would struggle if more than 2 people and cases entered we were given a upgraded room on the 5th floor and a std on the 3rd another on th 4th the hotel stair case felt like a council estate. The 5th floor room was lovelly with own large balcony, but the 3rd floor room appeared clean but the pillows smelt of sweat we complained and they sent a maid who just sprayed them with freshner in the end they changed the pillows, the manager asked me to be quite in front of other guest as I asked for a room change but did not get this as they were full with school students The hotel is situated in a close walking distance from the La Ramplas however the side streets did not feel safe at night I went out side of the hotel about 6.00pm and someone outside appeared to be jacking up he may have been a diabetic but did not look that way, so would not recomend

Reviews.Title: “Don't go out after dark.........”
Reviews.Author: LondonJimmy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Barcelona. I will begin with the two good points about this hotel. -Check in was quick. -5 mins walk from Las Ramblas (only a valid good point during daylight) Now the rest... -At night the area is thriving with thieves, pickpockets, drug pushers and ladies of the night. If returning on your own in the small hours, expect to experience one of the above, if not all. -The rooms are dark and nasty. Hard beds, flooding bathroom, windows that don't shut. Noisy. However, the rooms on the higher floors were much better, I heard... -Rude desk staff. -Bad breakfast. -Overpriced. I urge you to avoid this place. I really enjoyed Barcelona but for it's seedy underbelly, and it seems this hotel is right in the middle of it. If I were to go again, i would stay in a chain hotel in a safer area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position good facilities at the Gutenberg”
Reviews.Author: JulieTurner007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gutenberg for 2 nights in June 2010, we are an English couple in our fifties. We booked 2 nights at the Gutenberg as part of a pre-cruise package through Cruise 1st. My first tip is check out the position of the Gutenberg on Google earth before you go and print out the map, the taxi drivers in Barcelona dont know where it is, this was mentioned by other reviewers on Trip Advisor and saved us a lot of hassle. It did not save us any money though beware the Barcelona taxi drivers, they think of a price and double it, check your taxi has a meter, that it is used and that you can view it, there is a surcharge for pick ups from the airport ( 2 or 3e)and 1e per bag too (if you get charged approx 30e from airport thats about right). Once you have found the hotel, which is tucked away but in a really great position for sight seeing in Barcelona, just off the main shopping and tourist area and near the port vell (worth a visit and easy walking distance)with more shopping, good eating and the large Barcelona Aquarium (good but pricey). The famous La Rambla is the next street to the hotel, where there are living statues, artists, flower sellers, a huge fruit market, and the smaller maze of shops that make up the Les Rambles are just on the other side of la Rambla. These streets are too narrow for vehicles and make up a labyrinth of small independant businesses, some touristy, some expensive and exclusive and quite a few trade only jewellery wholesalers, plus of course pavement cafes. Beware of the prices with these cafes, we paid 6 euros for a coffee you dont want to do that too often. There is a good "carre fore" supermarket in La Rambla we stocked up on iced coffee, croissonts, cheese and fruit from the fruit market (cheaper if you venture in than buying from the first stall). This was possible because our room in the Gutenberg contained a small but useful kitchen area, including a working fridge !! very useful we had Fruit and croissonts with ham and cheese for breakfast each day, in bed, yummy. Unfortunately no kettle but it was a God send to have the fridge (and a hot plate which we didn't use). the Gutenberg also have a cafe on site with quite reasonable prices but we only had drinks there. The Room- The rooms were a good size, we had a big wardrobe, a big bed (actually two put together), armchair, dressing table, chair, mini kitchette, Bathroom with small bath with shower over, basin, toilet, with space for toilettries, nice towels, red decor but it worked! The airconditioner did work well once we worked out how to use it, it has three settings off, on fan only and air con, the first night we had it on fan NOT air con (the light blue symbol is air con) but once we worked out what went wrong we were OK. There is also a safe in the room, a hair dryer, a TV but local channels only. Everything was clean and they were helpful, allowing us to drop our luggage in a secure area before we checked in as we had an early flight and arrived three hours before our room was ready. This wasn't luxury but it was good value for money and as we only intended it as a base for our two days in Barcelona before our cruise it was perfect (particularly for its position). Just a note on Barcelona- Barcelona is expensive, food, transport so expect to pay pay pay this is not a place to get a bargain. The Airport- Due to circumstances beyond our control we had to get to Barcelona airport 7 hours before our flight, but having checked in on-line we expected to drop our bags and have a meal and wander around the shops for 7 hours. No such luck! easy jet refused to allow us to bag drop, even though they have a "Bag Drop" desk they only use it as if it were a regular check in, so we waited on metal chairs for 4 hours, with nothing to entertain or amuse us except the company of other disgruntled Bag drop customers who like us had expected to leave their luggage and enjoy the airport. However after 4 hours and finally being allowed to check in (again) we found to our dismay that the new airport has many shop units but the majority are empty shells, there was nothing to do for the remaining 3 hours either, just slightly more comfortable seating. Note to easy jet- Get the concept of Bag Drop through to your staff in Barcelona !!!!!!!! Note to Barcelona Airport - get the airlines to understand Bag Drop thereby giving tourists early access to the retail units, encouraging travellers to buy things while they wait for their flights, the more time they spend on the "secure" side ,the more money they will spend and you can encourage businesses into those empty shops. After 4 hours in a cavernous and uncomfortable check in waiting area I didn't feel like giving anyone any more of my hard earned cash, but 7 hours in a shopping centre enviroment may well have seperated me and my cash, and we'd all have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, service was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Kikimaniek
Reviews.Content: I was suppose to go back to Holland when a vulcanic eruption extended my stay in Barcelona. I had to change hotels, because my previous hotel was way to expensive to be staying in for longer. I found Gutenberg appartments, and I'm so glad I did!! The service the people from the reception gave me was beyond excellent! The helped me when I had to call Spanish organizations involving my return to Holland and even made sure I had a alternative way to travel to Holland. Everyday I had to book another night in de hotel and it was never a problem. The first room I was staying in was very very large, with its own kitchen. It had a balcony and I could sit in the sun reading my book in de afternoon. THe last night I had to stay in a smaller room, because a party of 3 was staying in my first room. Also not a problem, as i was just by myself, and was already glad I was able to stay another night in this hotel. Its very near the metrostation and just 2 streets away from la Rambla AND the sea, so the location couldnt be any better to me. And although it was in the center, I never heard any noises from the street, so my sleep was very good. I would recommend this hotel to anyone I know!!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, clean and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: lornamharper
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Barcelona today and enjoyed my stay at the Gutenberg hotel. We paid extra for a 'superior' room, and from what I can tell, that just meant it was one of the rooms that had been renovated. It looked like the whole hotel was in the process of a makeover with the rooms being redecorated from the top down. The standard rooms looked to be of a similar size and were just a bit dated in their decor. The room came with a small kitchenette with fridge which was useful for storing drinks. The rooms were clean and tidy and the shower in the bathroom was excellent. The beds were comfy, it was just a shame that we were given a triple room with three single beds when we had booked a double. The location of the hotel is very central. A minutes walk from La Rambla and 5 minutes down to the waters edge. The Old Town is nearby and Drassanes metro stop is just a stones throw away. The street the hotel is located on looks a little dodgy, but it was quiet enough. Breakfast was basic but good and the staff were all friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Srubka
Reviews.Content: It is a great place to stay in terms of the location. It is metres away from La Rabmla and minutes away from the seaside giving you great location for evenings walks. The room itself is nice. It is quite simple but very good at the same time.There is a small kitchen with everything you need. We had a small balcony, which is nice as well. The service was great. The guys in reception were really helpful. You can even use internet in the lobby for free. They have 2 computers and wi-fi. As far as I know they have wi-fi on 1st and 2nd floor in the rooms. We stayed on 3rd floor and there was no access to internet but we could still use the lobby,. They also offer breakfasts for 7 euros. The food is decent and it helps if you want to save a bit of time. Overall well recommended, great location, good standard and nice service, which makes it a very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base”
Reviews.Author: Wee_monsieur
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in August and found it expensive for a basic room and breakfast - but then it was peak period. Great location as a base to see the sights in Barcelona, just round the corner from the main Rambla and ther statue of Christopher Columbus. Good air-con, which we had to turn down,as it was too cold at night! The bedroom walls are paper-thin, though and you could hear most of what was going on in the rooms either side of yours. The staff were very helpfiul and friendly and there was free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “All you need in a hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Cristina_Bucharest
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location, it's 5 minutes away from the harbor and from the lively Rambla, but in a more quiet location, it has nice rooms, large enough, with a very useful kitchinette, especially if you travel with small children. The breakfast is ok, the staff is very helpful and friendly, the rooms are cleaned every day, you have free access to the internet on the computers situated in the lobby. It's really all you need for a perfect stay in the beautiful Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, basic, but spotlessly clean.”
Reviews.Author: Vreen
Reviews.Content: Sayed here for one night. Hotel clientele seemed to be aged 30 - 60 years old. Maybe it depends opn the time of year you stay here. Beds were comfortable, room was fairly small, but had kitchenette and was very clean. Reception staff were knowledgeable and extremely helpful. Located at bottom end of ramblas, we returned to the hotel on foot at around 1.00am and felt completey safe. The room was very quiet and we had a good nights sleep followed by a buffet breakfast which was fairly basic, but plenty of choice. Would stay here again for one night breaks,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: ThinkingCamilo
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, which is incredibly trendy for a hostel. very complete rooms, with TV and air conditioning, wood floors, efficient housekeeping. They have a really cheap vending machine, which is a commodity, a public computer with high speed internet, large LCD TV in the lobby and tow nice couches, a perfect living room to hang out in. God bless this hostel for trying to respect the non-Spanish concept of breakfast. Fruit, tea, variety of bread, if you want eggs there's tortilla, all the orange juice you want and tables... Amazingly, this hostel is totally trendy and well designed, I would recommend it fully.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Value. Fantastic location!!”
Reviews.Author: kellierenshaw
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at this Hotel in March 2008 (it was a gift for my partners 21st Birthday) The hotel was basic and clean. The beds were a little unconfortable and yes it was noisy at night (bring an ipod) but the location is amazing, you are more or less right on la rambles. Apparently the speakers in the room meant to play pan piped music but ours didn't work :( shame. we used the hotel as a place to sleep, there is so much to do in Barcelona that you dont need a hotel to chill out in. If you are going to Chill out then you better splash out on a more expensive hotel! we liked the Hotel and would stay again, the breakfast was good. Coffee, tea, juice, cearal, fruit, chesse, meat, breads, very filling! :D top reason to stay here> Great location - steps away from transport.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and comfortable with good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: vst08
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Gutenberg, my brother and I just wanted somewhere clean and comfortable right in the centre. The Gutenberg was great value when compared to other hotels of similar location and standard. The room was also a good size and we were lucky enough to get a small balcony...although it rained all weekend! The staff were great, happy to advise and remembered your name and then greeted you by name each time we returned...that counts. Room was basic, with tiled floor and 2 single beds, it was very clean as was the bathroom. Breakfast was simple, cereal, toast or croissant, and the coffee suprisingly drinkable. Its less than a minutes walk from the Ramblas, Gothic Quarter and Port, making it a great base.

Reviews.Title: “Roach motel!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravel70
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to good reviews on more than one web site. Either those folks had a much different experience than us or they lied. This hotel is a complete dump. The elevators barely fit two people and two suitcases. The room had a roach in it and the shower was FULL of mold. It was just disgusting. My bf took pictures and went down to the desk to discuss with the staff. They tried to find another room, but it honestly took them two or three more rooms to find one that was acceptable. We turned it down and checked out the next morning. We spoke to the manager the next morning, showing him the photos. He said that his desk staff showed us 5 rooms (not true) and we declined them all. He said he didn't know where those photos were taken and refused to come up to the room to see for himself. He also said he would have to think about whether or not to refund us the two nights we would not be staying there (we paid in advance through the website), although we gave notice the previous night that we would not be staying there. As of now (a week later), we have not received the refund.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: traveller1074
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend break for my friends 50th birthday. There was 8 men in 1 double and 2 triple rooms. We all agreed that the Hotel was in a perfect location and it was a very good Hotel. The staff on the desk were very friendly, helpful and spoke good english. The Hotel had the feel of a family run Hotel as opposed to a corporate Hotel. Breakfast was served in a pleasant room and was quite adequate for us. I agree with some previous reviews, the surrounding streets can be a little intimidating at night, best to approach from main road and a quick left into reception, but I must say, we did not encounter any problems and we used the side streets to get to Hotel. The Ramblas is a 2 minute walk away and the marina is just 5 minutes away. All of us would stay at this Hotel without hesitation, again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, and very friendly receptionist!”
Reviews.Author: Todiscover
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Gutenberg aparthotel Barcelona for 5 nights, from 19 to 25 December i think, and I loved the place! If you like simple, warm and clean places where u have all what u need, u'll love this hotel! Our first impression was great thanks to the friendly receptionist who spoke some arabic words! The streets in Barcelona were very cold, and when we get in the room, my friend and I were surprised, it was soooo waaaarm!! the room was very clean, with 2 twin confortable beds. there was a "cupboard", but when we opened it we realized that it was a kitchen actually,lol (stupid country girls!!) there was all what you need to cook and eat in your room, there was a small fridge as well the bathroom was very simple but clean but what is amazing in this hotel is the location, it's in "las Ramblas"!! u can have fun all the time, do shopping, go to the passeo Maritimo, all this 5 to 20minutes walking from the hotel also there is a metro station (green line) 2 minutes walk from the hotel It's a cosy place when u can feel home! there is a Carrefour market about 10 minutes walk from the hotel, and also a popular market where u can buy a delicious fruit juce, and a lot of chocolate!! to go to Plaza Catalonia, Parallel, Gaudi museum, it will take 20min to 30min walk, or u can take the Metro (the green line), it will take u even to the Camp Nou (Reina Christina station)

Reviews.AuthorLocation: North York Moors National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Good customer service.”
Reviews.Author: ditsydaisy2010
Reviews.Content: Two couples travelling, we arrived at Hotel at 6pm Saturday evening (day before Barcelona Marathon) and found that the website we booked through had cancelled our booking. The staff were very helpful even though they said they couldn't accommodate us in the two twin rooms which we had originally booked. They offered us a quad room on the top floor for the first night which was very spacious and modern and much better than we had hoped. The next day our friends were offered a twin room and we were allowed to stay for the rest of the trip in the quad room. The hotel is clean, central and close to La Ramblas and we didn't feel threatened when returning to the Hotel late at night ,despite it being near the so called red light district. A buffet breakfast was included in the price which had a very good variety to choose from and set us up for the day. Would definitely stay there again.
